headline.print_headline: Exhibit A in Debate Over Castro’s State
headline.seo: Photo Appears to Put the Lie to Rumors of Castro’s Death
headline.main: Exhibit A in Debate Over Castro’s State

docs.snippet: With rumors churning that Fidel Castro was dead or nearly so, a former vice president of Venezuela showed off a picture of what he said was his recent encounter with the former Cuban leader....
docs.abstract: Venezuelan politician Elias Jaua says he met with former Cuban leader Fidel Castro, publicizing picture in which Castro appears to be in good health; move is likely part of effort by Cuba and Venezuela to dispute rumors that Castro is either dead or dying.

byline.contributor: A reporter for The New York Times contributed reporting from Havana.

docs.lead_paragraph: With rumors churning that Fidel Castro was dead or nearly so, a former vice president of Venezuela showed off a picture of what he said was his recent encounter with the former Cuban leader.

headline.print_headline: Depleted Ravens Defense Crumbles Against Texans
headline.main: Depleted Ravens Defense Crumbles Against Texans

docs.snippet: Aided by two touchdown passes from quarterback Matt Schaub, Houston imposed its will Sunday on Baltimore in a victory that reaffirmed its supremacy in the A.F.C....
docs.lead_paragraph: Aided by two touchdown passes from quarterback Matt Schaub, Houston imposed its will Sunday on Baltimore in a victory that reaffirmed its supremacy in the A.F.C.

docs.snippet: Kateri Tekakwitha and Sister Marianne Cope were named saints at a Vatican ceremony....

headline.print_headline: Man Is Charged In Queens Rape
headline.seo: Man Charged in Rape and Robbery at Massage Parlors in Queens
headline.main: Man Is Charged in Queens Rape

docs.snippet: Zhordrack Blodywon, 40, was arrested in connection with an attack at a massage parlor and a robbery at a second massage parlor last week....
docs.abstract: Zhordrack Blodywon is arrested on charges of raping a woman at a massage parlor in Queens and robbing a second massage parlor in Great Neck, NY.
docs.lead_paragraph: Zhordrack Blodywon, 40, was arrested in connection with an attack at a massage parlor and a robbery at a second massage parlor last week.

headline.print_headline: Vilma Returns to Saints, But Brees Is the Difference
headline.seo: Vilma Returns to Saints, But Brees Is Difference in Win Over Tampa Bay
headline.main: Vilma Returns to Saints, but Brees Is the Difference

docs.snippet: Jonathan Vilma gave New Orleans’s struggling defense an emotional lift, and Drew Brees did the rest for the suddenly resurgent Saints in their victory Sunday over Tampa Bay....
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; New Orleans Saints defeat Tampa Bay Buccaneers, 35-28; Saints quarterback Drew Brees has another stellar outing and linebacker Jonathan Vilma returns from bounty-related suspension; other football scores noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jonathan Vilma gave New Orleans’s struggling defense an emotional lift, and Drew Brees did the rest for the suddenly resurgent Saints in their victory Sunday over Tampa Bay.

docs.snippet: Both President Obama and Mitt Romney have said government does not create jobs. But the government does in fact create jobs, millions of important jobs....
docs.abstract: Editorial disputes notion that government does not create jobs, which both presidential candidates seemed to espouse in the second debate; contends that government in fact creates millions of important jobs, and suggests that at this time of state budgetary hardship, federal fiscal aid to states and localities could create more jobs in both public and private sectors.
docs.lead_paragraph: Both President Obama and Mitt Romney have said government does not create jobs. But the government does in fact create jobs, millions of important jobs.

headline.print_headline: Faith, Football and the First Amendment
headline.seo: Faith, Football and the First Amendment
headline.main: Faith, Football and the First Amendment

docs.snippet: A Texas case about religious expression at a public school is testing whether a landmark Supreme Court ruling is still the law of the land....
docs.abstract: Editorial warns that Texas case in which a state court judge allowed high school cheerleaders in Kountze, Tex, to display religious-themed banners at football games is testing whether landmark Supreme Court ruling regarding separation between church and state is still law of the land.
docs.lead_paragraph: A Texas case about religious expression at a public school is testing whether a landmark Supreme Court ruling is still the law of the land.

headline.print_headline: For Congress From New York and Connecticut
headline.seo: For Congress From New York and Connecticut
headline.main: For Congress From New York and Connecticut

docs.snippet: Here are endorsements in six Congressional races....
docs.abstract: Editorial endorses Democrats Mark Murphy, Sean Patrick Maloney, Dan Maffei, Louise Slaughter and Kathy Hochul in New York Congressional elections; endorses Democrat Elizabeth Esty in Connecticut Congressional election.
docs.lead_paragraph: Here are endorsements in six Congressional races.

headline.print_headline: Canada Still Ponders Deal For Fuel Firm
headline.seo: Canada Could Approve Deal It Blocked for Energy Company
headline.main: Canada Still Ponders Deal for Fuel Firm

docs.snippet: Canada said the bid for Progress Energy Resources by the Malaysian state oil company Petronas, did not provide the “net benefit” required by law but that negotiations were continuing....
docs.abstract: Canada's Finance Min Jim Flaherty says country could still approve $5.2 billion acquisition of Progress Energy Resources by Malaysian state oil company Petronas, despite having blocked the deal.
docs.lead_paragraph: Canada said the bid for Progress Energy Resources by the Malaysian state oil company Petronas, did not provide the “net benefit” required by law but that negotiations were continuing.

docs.snippet: Here’s what Mitt Romney can say in Monday night’s debate to sound like a credible commander in chief....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Bill Keller Op-Ed column establishes threshold level of competence and judgement on foreign policy that Mitt Romney must surpass in final presidential debate; offers Romney advice on what to say to sound like credible commander in chief.
docs.lead_paragraph: Here’s what Mitt Romney can say in Monday night’s debate to sound like a credible commander in chief.
